comments:
[EMF I2005102000124 on Eclipse 3.1.1]

Wherever this comes from now:
Warning 2005-10-27 17:41:13.661 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl$DependencyHelper.<init>(GenPackageImpl.java:1650)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl.generate(GenPackageImpl.java:2176)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenModelImpl.generate(GenModelImpl.java:1745)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.presentation.GenModelActionBarContributor$3.generate(GenModelActionBarContributor.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.presentation.GenModelActionBarContributor$9.execute(GenModelActionBarContributor.java:279)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1719)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:110)

org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Please provide a reproduceable test case/scenario.  It looks to me like your
model would have to be in an interesting state to get a NPE there.

I want to generate code for model A, which refers to some base classes in model
B, with B residing in a different plugin than A.

When I open A.genmodel, I get to see this:
"Problems encountered in the model
  The package 'platform:/resource/managedobject/src/managedobject.ecore#/' is
needed but isn't accessible from the Generator model"

When exactly does it say that? B.ecore and B.genmodel are part of the binary
build of plugin B, plugin A imports B, and B exports all packages of its jar.

Here is an example of a supertype reference in A:
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Benutzer"
eSuperTypes="../../managedobject/src/managedobject.ecore#//User #//KunstdbObject">

I took A.(ecore|genmodel) from one plugin project (where everything works) and
copied it into another plugin project. Plugin project B (managedobject) is an
open project in the workspace.
